Ratings.comment: Loved every second of this class. Amazing!
Dr. Abrams is by far one of my favorite professors. She makes the material extremely easy to digest, and is very considerate. Just be honest and communicate with her, and you will pass the class.

Dr. Abrams truly cares about you succeeding. She doesn't hesitate to spend one on one time with students in class until they understand a concept. The overall class is simple and straight forward and Dr. Abrams is really kind and funny and actually remembers her students and goes above and beyond for her classes. 10/10 professor!

Lisa Abrams is an angel. She is such an amazing woman, and such a boss! This kick ass woman knows her worth and makes sure you know yours as well. She has endless resources and is happy to share them and help you. She makes everyone comfortable and is just absolutely fabulous. My favorite woman!

Dr. Abrams is a very caring professor, and I'm glad I was able to take this class. She creates a comfortable environment and seems likes she really wants the best for her students. There wasn't hardly any work in this class and it was mostly discussion based.

She organized the weekend well. The moderators were very entertaining and helped me with my public speaking and teamwork skills. They also offer some food during the sessions. It was a sacrifice (waking up early on the weekend and missing the welcome week concert), but i think it was worth it! The class was also S/U, so no effect on GPA.
One of my favorite professors I've had.

Very nice lady and excellent teacher. If you have any questions at all she answers them and more. She wants to see you succeed and gives you everything you need to do so. If you show up, kind of pay attention and do the (limited) homework, you're fine. Group projects are kind of tedious, but not awful. Overall she's a great teacher, def. reccommend

Expects too much energy early in the morning.  Treats everyone like a child.  Appears very interested in the generally lame parts of the course, and does not show a deep understanding of any material.  She is very helpful though, and if you like enthusiasm, there is plenty of it.
Great prof - very engaging, nice, will bring Timbits to class if the class is nice.

AMAZING!!! Professor Abrams is very engaging and enjoyable to listen to. She clearly explains everything, and most importantly, you can tell that she loves to teach. Can't wait to take her 5680 class!!!

Dr. Abrams is probably my favorite teacher I've had in my 3 years at OSU thus far. She is very helpful and understanding and really knows how to inspire her students. It is not terrible to keep up with the material as long as you stay ahead.
Dr. Abrams and Dr. Lilly were fantastic. They were honestly the best professors i have had here at OSU barring Dr. Clymer who was also phenomenal. Cant wait to take 621 with her.
She is an awesome professor not only this class but I am sure for others.

Lisa has been one of my all time favorite teachers in ME. She is very helpful & genuinely interested in helping you. Not mandatory attendance but she does take the time to get to know everyone and she will notice if you aren't there. Class is graded pretty easy overall as long as you complete all assignments. She is very knowledgeable at Solidworks
Easy class as long as you keep up.  Do well on the project and the midterm/final are easy.  Class can get boring after a while if you are familiar with SolidWorks.

1281.01H is a work-heavy class, but Dr. Grzybowski and her TA team made it an amazing class. An incredibly caring and focused person who puts in the effort to help her students in every way possible. Great professor.

Took her online during covid. She's pretty nice and very accessible outside of class. Whenever I emailed her, she responded instantly. Lectures are dry, but this is first year engineering so yeah. I would definitely recommend her, she was super flexible.

Dr Deb is the only professor this semester who seems to actually care about her students. She is very easy to talk to and is extremely understanding. I made sure to take her other class next semester as well. I will remember her for my whole life. It is also inspiring as a female engineering student to see someone do what you want to do one day!

I took this in Au2017. Dr. Deb was knowledgeable about MATLAB. I enjoyed her instruction, but there were a lot of kinks to work out of the coursework because someone not in education created the material and disconnect with instructors not creating the instructions. She gave extra credit and pop quiz heads up if attendance was low so go to class

Dr. Deb really cares about her students. However, she did a poor job of explaining the Graphics content. Although she is a knowledgeable resource for the Microfluidics and Nanotechnology project, she wasn't accessible because she often absent from class (ironically busy with engineering education research) and slow to return emails.

Deb is very nice. FEH was one of the worst classes I've ever taken, but that had little to do with her. She really cares about her students, and will certainly help you out if you seek her. She can be a bit unclear sometimes, but she is knowledgeable. That said, FEH is pretty self-taught and ran by the department, so the professor doesn't matter.
Dr. Deb is awesome. She really cares about her students and is always there to help- all you have to do is ask.

She didn't always seem to know exactly what she was talking about. Not because she didn't know but because she knew too much. She needed the TA's help during lectures a lot and didn't always know how the APPs worked.
1282.02H was a very open-ended class and Nanotechnology is pretty confusing, but Dr. Deb was very helpful with questions and clearing up misconceptions. Very energetic and loves what she teaches.

This was the FEH version; the class was very easy. A lot of the material was cumbersome, ridiculous, and unnecessary. Dr. Deb, though one of the nicest ladies I have ever met, was not all that helpful at all. My TA's were phenomenal, but Dr. Deb herself wasn't helpful at all and it came to the point where I avoided asking for her help.
Taught FEH programming. I love this lady! So helpful and energetic.  My favourite instructor by far.
VERY HELPFUL.  She genuinely cares about her students and wants everyone to succeed.  I?m not a huge programming fan, but she made it understandable.  Awesome professor.

Taught my FEH programming class. It was her first time teaching the class and she started out somewhat frazzled, but got much better by the end. Sometimes uses weird examples but explains everything very thoroughly one on one. Genuinely nice lady, really cares about her students and helping them succeed.
